name: Peking Roasted Duck
desp: Thin and crispy duck skin, often eaten with pancakes and sauces.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
desp: Spicy Sichuan dish with diced chicken, chili, cucumber, and peanuts.

name: Sweet and Sour Pork
desp: Bright orange-red pork with a delicious sweet and sour taste.

name: Hot Pot
desp: Simmering pot of broth with various meats and vegetables cooked at the table.

name: Dim Sum
desp: Cantonese dish with a variety of small items like dumplings and rolls.

name: Dumplings
desp: Minced meat and vegetables wrapped in dough, boiled, steamed, or fried.

name: Ma Po Tofu
desp: Spicy tofu with minced meat, fermented black beans, and chili paste.

name: Char Siu
desp: Cantonese roast pork, often eaten with rice or as a filling in buns.

name: Chow Mein
desp: Stir-fried noodles with meat, onions, and celery, invented to preserve food.

name: Twice-Cooked Pork Slices
desp: Fried rice with eggs, vegetables, and meat, popular and easy to make.
